title: Smart Garden Sensor
summary: A low-power soil moisture + temp sensor using ESP32 and LoRa, with a simple solar charger.

content.intro: This Smart Garden Sensor measures soil moisture and temperature and reports via LoRa to a central gateway. It's built around an ESP32-S2, optimized for low power with deep-sleep cycles.
content.wiring: Connect the sensor: VCC → 3.3V, GND → GND, SDA → GPIO21, SCL → GPIO22. See diagram.
content.firmware:
1. Flash the firmware using esptool or OTA.
  2. Configure WiFi/LoRa credentials in config.json.
content.qa:
Q: How long does the battery last?
A: ~6 months with daily reporting and a small solar panel.

title: DIY Bluetooth Speaker
summary: Compact speaker with class-D amp and Bluetooth module, 3D-printed enclosure.

content.intro: This DIY Bluetooth Speaker pairs with phones and uses a PAM8403 class-D amp. Perfect for a small desktop speaker with boosted bass.
content.wiring: Connect speakers to the amp outputs, power the amp with 5V, and connect the Bluetooth module TX/RX to the microcontroller if using an external MCU.

firmwareVersions.notes: Improved audio latency and volume curve.
Initial board bring-up and audio path.

content.qa: Q: Can I use a larger battery? A: Yes — ensure amp voltage limits are respected.

title: Home Energy Monitor
summary: Non-invasive current transformer + Raspberry Pi collector, storing data to InfluxDB.

content.intro: The Home Energy Monitor uses CT clamps to measure mains current and sends summaries to a Raspberry Pi running a collector that stores to InfluxDB.
content.wiring: Clip CT sensors around each mains conductor and route the sensor outputs to the ADS1115 or analog front-end. See safety notes.

firmwareVersions.notes: Stability fixes and better ADC calibration.

content.qa: Q: Is installation safe? A: Work with mains electricity only if qualified; use appropriate insulation and safety practices.
